verses.text: Against Moab thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, the God of Israel; Woe unto Nebo! for it is spoiled: Kiriathaim is confounded \add and\add* taken: Misgab is confounded and dismayed.

\add There shall be\add* no more praise of Moab: In Heshbon they have devised evil against it; Come, and let us cut it off from \add being\add* a nation. Also thou shalt be cut down, O Madmen; The sword shall pursue thee.
A voice of crying \add shall be\add* from Horonaim, Spoiling and great destruction.
Moab is destroyed; Her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.
For \add in\add* the going up of Luhith Continual weeping shall go up; For in the going down of Horonaim The enemies have heard a cry of destruction.
Flee, save your lives, And be like the heath in the wilderness.
For because thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures, Thou shalt also be taken: And Chemosh shall go forth into captivity \add With\add* his priests and his princes together.
And the spoiler shall come upon every city, And no city shall escape: The valley also shall perish, And the plain shall be destroyed, As the \sc Lord\sc* hath spoken.
Give wings unto Moab, That it may flee and get away: For the cities thereof shall be desolate, Without any to dwell therein.
Cursed \add be\add* he that doeth the work of the \sc Lord\sc* deceitfully, And cursed \add be\add* he that keepeth back his sword from blood.

Moab hath been at ease from his youth, And he \add hath\add* settled on his lees, And hath not been emptied from vessel to vessel, Neither hath he gone into captivity: Therefore his taste remained in him, And his sent is not changed.
Therefore behold, the days come, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, That I will send unto him wanderers, that shall cause him to wander, And shall empty his vessels, and break their bottles.
And Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, As the house of Israel was ashamed of Beth-el their confidence.
How say ye, We \add are\add* mighty and strong men for the war?
Moab is spoiled, and gone up \add out of\add* her cities, And his chosen young men are gone down to the slaughter, Saith the King, whose name \add is\add* the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
The calamity of Moab \add is\add* near to come, And his affliction hasteth fast.
All ye that are about him, bemoan him; And all ye that know his name, Say, How is the strong staff broken, \add And\add* the beautiful rod!
Thou daughter that dost inhabit Dibon, Come down from \add thy\add* glory, and sit in thirst; For the spoiler of Moab shall come upon thee, \add And\add* he shall destroy thy strong holds.
O inhabitant of Aroer, Stand by the way and espy; Ask him that fleeth, and her that escapeth, \add And\add* say, What is done?
Moab is confounded; for it is broken down: Howl and cry; Tell ye \add it\add* in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled,
And judgment is come upon the plain country; Upon Holon, and upon Jahazah, and upon Mephaath,
And upon Dibon, and upon Nebo, and upon Beth-diblathaim,
And upon Kiriathaim, and upon Beth-gamul, and upon Beth-meon,
And upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, And upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.
The horn of Moab is cut off, And his arm is broken, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Make ye him drunken: for he magnified \add himself\add* against the \sc Lord\sc*: Moab also shall wallow in his vomit, And he also shall be in derision.
For was not Israel a derision unto thee? Was he found among thieves? For since thou spakest of him, thou skippedst for joy.
O ye that dwell in Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock, And be like the dove \add that\add* maketh her nest in the sides of the hole’s mouth.
We have heard the pride of Moab; \add he is\add* exceeding proud: His loftiness, and his arrogancy, and his pride, and the haughtiness of his heart.
I know his wrath, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; but \add it shall\add* not \add be\add* so; His lies shall not so effect \add it\add*.
Therefore will I howl for Moab, And I will cry out for all Moab; \add Mine heart\add* shall mourn for the men of Kir-heres.

O vine of Sibmah, I will weep for thee with the weeping of Jazer: Thy plants are gone over the sea, They reach \add even\add* to the sea of Jazer: The spoiler is fallen upon thy summer fruits and upon thy vintage.

And joy and gladness is taken from the plentiful field, and from the land of Moab; And I have caused wine to fail from the wine presses: None shall tread \add with\add* shouting; \add Their\add* shouting \add shall be\add* no shouting.

From the cry of Heshbon \add even\add* unto Elealeh, \add And even\add* unto Jahaz, have they uttered their voice, From Zoar \add even\add* unto Horonaim, \add As\add* a heifer of three years old: For the waters also of Nimrim shall be desolate.
Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, him that offereth \add in\add* the high places, And him that burneth incense to his gods.
Therefore mine heart shall sound for Moab like pipes, And mine heart shall sound like pipes for the men of Kir-heres: Because the riches \add that\add* he hath gotten are perished.
For every head \add shall be\add* bald, And every beard clipt: Upon all the hands \add shall be\add* cuttings, And upon the loins sackcloth.

\add There shall be\add* lamentation generally upon all the housetops of Moab, and in the streets thereof: For I have broken Moab like a vessel wherein \add is\add* no pleasure, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
They shall howl, \add saying\add*, How is it broken down! How hath Moab turned the back with shame! So shall Moab be a derision and a dismaying to all them about him.
For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Behold, he shall fly as an eagle, And shall spread his wings over Moab.
Kerioth is taken, and the strong holds are surprised, And the mighty \add men’s\add* hearts in Moab at that day shall be As the heart of a woman in her pangs.
And Moab shall be destroyed from \add being\add* a people, Because he hath magnified \add himself\add* against the \sc Lord\sc*.
Fear, and the pit, and the snare, \add shall be\add* upon thee, O inhabitant of Moab, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

He that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit; And he that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare: For I will bring upon it, \add even\add* upon Moab, the year of their visitation, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

They that fled stood under the shadow of Heshbon because of the force: But a fire shall come forth out of Heshbon, And a flame from the midst of Sihon, And shall devour the corner of Moab, And the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.
Woe be unto thee, O Moab! The people of Chemosh perisheth: For thy sons are taken captives, And thy daughters captives.
Yet will I bring again the captivity of Moab In the latter days, saith the \sc Lord\sc*. Thus far \add is\add* the judgment of Moab.
